question.question-text: Based on the information in paragraph 1, who would have been most likely to own a car in 1900?

answer-list.answer-text: A skilled laborer
A successful investor
A scholarship student
A rural farmer

question.question-text: The word frivolous in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to

answer-list.answer-text: trivial delicate essential natural

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 1 that it was necessary to repair early autos because of

answer-list.answer-text: the elaborate engines
the lack of roads
the immature drivers
the rough roads

question.question-text: The author refers to four-legged engines in paragraph 1 in order to indicate that

answer-list.answer-text: early autos had little more than an engine and wheels
it was foolishÂ· to travel on a four-legged animal
horses were an effective mode of transportation
automobile engines were evaluated in terms of their horsepower

insert-text.b: These horrendous road conditions forced drivers to use their automobiles on grooved, rutted, and bumpy roads.

question.question-text: The phrase many others in paragraph 2 refers to

answer-list.answer-text: automobiles in the beginning of the twentieth century
today's models
electric models
electric charging stations

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 2 that the owners of steam-powered cars

answer-list.answer-text: sometimes had to demonstrate knowledge of steam engineering
had to hire drivers to operate their cars
often had to take their automobiles to charging stations
were often in danger because of the limited range of their automobiles

question.question-text: Why does the author mention benches on wheels in paragraph 2?

answer-list.answer-text: To show how remarkably automobile design had progressed
To show that car designs of the time were neither complex nor comfortable
To indicate that early automobiles had upholstered chairs or sofas
To emphasize how the early automobiles were designed to absorb the pounding of the machine on the road

question.question-text: The word incessant in paragraph 2 is closest in meaning to

answer-list.answer-text: heavy
bothersome
jolting
continual

question.question-text: The word fester in paragraph 3 could be best replaced by

answer-list.answer-text: full of
surrounded by
dangerous due to
occurring as a result of

question.question-text: It can be inferred from paragraph 3 that the government of New York state believed that

answer-list.answer-text: all horseless vehicles should be banned from all public parks
strict speed limits should be placed on horse-drawn carriages
horseless and horse-drawn vehicles should not travel on the same roads
it was safer for cars to travel faster where there was less traffic and fewer people

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 3? Incorrect choices change the meaning in important ways or leave out essential information.

answer-list.answer-text: It was necessary to take a measured approach in dealing with inventions such as the automobile.
The various laws were needed because the use of automobiles grew so fast
The dramatic look of the automobile changed considerably over a short period of time.
It was important to lawmakers to discover the causes of the problems relating to automobiles.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 3, it is NOT true that

answer-list.answer-text: the total cost of the automobiles sold in the United States in 1900 was around $5 million
sales of cars increased by more than 175,000 from 1900 to 1910
automobile manufacturing was the top U.S. industry in 1920
automobile manufacturing represented more than 5 percent of total U.S. manufacturing by 1925
